title: Cannot disconnect old unused device from Connected Devices
content:
Hello!

I have an issue with the Connected Devices section. There is my old PC which is listed as being connected 5 months ago and I cannot get rid of it. Whenever I'm trying to share a tab/link to another devices it shows up in the list 6 times (please see the screenshot attached).

I've tried Firefox on Windows, Linux, iOS. None of these can help me remove the device from the Connected Devices. I press Disconnect, select an option (random, doesn't matter), and then nothing. It's still there.

Any idea what I can do?

Thank you!

title: Data recovery from Windows 7 to Windows 11.
content:
The Motherboard on my Windows 7 gave up, however the SSD that it was on is still working properly.

I have seen it on an alternative Windows 7 computer.

I specifically wish to recover the the Bookmarks that is on the Mozilla Firefox browser, and also all of my emails on Mozilla Thunderbird.

I would be most grateful, if someone can please tell me how this can be done?
creator: Suksan

title: Auto-update doesn't work unless user goes into Help > About Firefox
content:
We've got 91.5 ESR installed on all machines, and I want to use auto-updating to get everyone up to 91.6. Here's what my mozilla.cfg has in relation to auto-updating:

lockPref("app.update.enabled", true); lockPref("app.update.auto", true); lockPref("app.update.service.enabled", true); lockPref("app.update.silent", true); defaultPref("app.update.auto.migrated", true);

But the problem I have is that the update won't trigger unless the user goes into File > About Firefox. They don't need to click on anything within that window - just need to open the About Mozilla Firefox window. Then when they close and re-open FF it will be on the new version.

I've tested this many times - if I just open and close FF with normal use then it never updates.

I can't imagine that this is the intended behaviour, because it's not "auto" if the user has to initiate it. And how many users are actually going to do that?

How do I get it so that all the user needs to do is to open FF for the update to happen.

Thanks.
creator: gwcgg

title: Remove context meny from Firefox downloads panel or open in Windows explorer instead
content:
When I download a PDF file, Firefox saves it in the downloads panel. This is fine, except when I right click to "Show in folder" this option has disappeared and the top option is "Open in System Viewer". I never want to open it in a system viewer because I've already been viewing it in the browser and I ever only download it so I can read it later.

My problem is, most of the time I end up clicking this option by mistake and hence have to go through a lengthy process of closing the viewer, opening Windows Explorer, going to the downloads folder and then moving the pdf to the folder I want to save it to on my file system.

My question is, how do I stop the context menu changing so it always has the "Show in folder" option at the top?

If this isn't possible, can I configure Firefox to open Windows Explorer instead of the download panel?
creator: s.j.tarr

title: Unable to download Google Drive files in Mozilla browser
content:
Hi Mozilla Community,

Currently on version 97.0.1 of Mozilla and have not been able to download any files from Google Drive.

When I click on a files to download it just keeps loading scripts at the bottom like - docs.0k.cc.googledocs.... and nothing happens.

I have read countless of links to solve the issue and still it won't download any files - only uploads is fine.

So I have: - clear cache/cookies - disable addons like Adblock etc - privacy & security set on Standard in settings - added cookies exceptions- googlecontent, googledrive etc - turned off Enhanced Tracking Protection

What else is missing as to why it has stopped allowing me to download files? Its quite frustrating when it use to work when I enable the third cookie party and now the setup doesn't seem to accept it.

Mozilla is my default browser and prefer to use it rather always switch to Chrome for downloads.

I've contacted Google about Google Drive and they said the problem is not on their side.

So any help would be appreciated!!
creator: booboo_girl21

title: since ~one week Discord logs me out again and again
content:
Hello,

I´m in Discord via Firefox web browser since years and never had any problems with unwanted logout´s. Closing the browser at day #1, opening it again at day #2 - np, still logged in. Now, since ~one week, it logs me out because of any slightest fart, even after just (test-wise) refreshing the Discord browser tab -> "Welcome back!" log-in screen, username, passwort, "beep boop" anti-bot-check, 2FA-code requested.

That happens only with Discord, I´m still logged in at any of my other webpages/accounts etc. I´ve changed nothing here, same Windows- and browser-versions (FF ESR 91.6.0), no new programs, configs, cleaners or add-on's, nothing. That virtually has begun from one moment to the next. Ofc it also happens in safe-mode. All Discord-cookies are still present after a browser-restart. Found a thread at r/Firefox where some users have experiencend the same problem. Discord-support couldn´t find any problem on their side.
creator: ax-turbo

title: Passwords lost during upgrade from 32 to 64 bit - please assist...
content:
I upgraded to 64 bit given my machine seemed to be up to spec to handle it, and hopefully avoid a lot of the crashing it's been doing lately. However, I lost my passwords. I have a password manager, but it was convenient with Firefox having them, and my cached sites, bookmarks, and other stuff. Not the end of the world, but would make my life easier having this back. Any ideas?

I looked through some articles to try and find the text or JSON files with this info, but no luck - either under the Firefox install files, or my Windows profile files. I also thought of uninstalling, just the 64 bit version, but not sure if the 32 bit will still be there when I'm done.

Unfortunately I never used the Mozilla/Firefox "sync" feature until now - so I didn't have them saved to the cloud. Any ideas?

Thanks, Tom

title: firefox blocked my auto payment site, had to use Chrome to pay my bill!!
content:
I wanted to pay a bill and got this:

Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to mysubarumotorsfinance.com. Peer’s Certificate has been revoked. Error code: SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

Sure!!, let me call them and tell them to fix their certificate! Luckily I have Chrome, and I used Chrome with no problem to pay my damn bill!

In addition to this stupidity, every single time I log onto a website I have to turn off the tracking shield because if I don't, the website does not work. I disabled this in settings, but it just comes right back again. I don't care about a site on which I have to pay a bill tracking me or not. Firefox is becoming so unusable, I may as well just use Chrome from now on. What the hell happened to the browser I have been using for almost two decades???

title: Mozilla doesn't recognize certificate issuer
content:
A site that I use several times every year recently wouldn't open. Response from Firefox is "Access Denied - Certificate issuer not recognized". Also kept getting bumped out of my email account and all my open tabs would close abruptly. The last may have been rectified but I still can't get into the website I want to access.

I've tried different browsers as well so I don't know if it's Mozilla only or my PC. Even if I type in https://www.(pagename).com, it displays as you don't have permission to access http://www.(pagename).com.

I changed nothing on my PC that would cause the problem.

title: Email Draft Issues
content:
I mainly use Firefox as my browser and use Microsoft Outlook for my university email. I already contacted university tech support and Microsoft Outlook tech support and neither was able to provide me with a solution except for suggesting it could be a browser issue.

When I draft an email, as I am typing the email will delete itself, archive itself, or try to set up some weird category system that I didn't initiate. It has become impossible to draft emails online for this reason because I never know when something might erase or delete as I type. I do not have any issues typing on other websites, including using Gmail.

Has anyone else had this issue before with Outlook?
creator: a314acosta
